text: Tōdai-ji () is a temple of the Huayan in Nara, Japan. It was built by order of Emperor Shōmu, 45th moarch of Japan in the Nara period. It is registered as a World Heritage Site as part of Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara. It is famous for a statue named Daibutsu. Category:Buddhist temples in Japan Category:World Heritage Sites in Japan Category:8th-century buildings and structures Category:Nara Prefecture
title: Tōdai-ji
